summary:
The UEFA Champions League is a yearly soccer tournament for Europe's top teams. It starts with a group stage, followed by knockout rounds, and a final. The competition is very popular and considered the most important club tournament in Europe.

Originally called the European Champion Clubs' Cup, it began in 1955 and was only for league champions. Over time, it evolved to include more teams, with the current format starting in 1992. The tournament now features 36 teams, with the top 24 advancing to the knockout phase. The winner gets to defend their title the following year and competes in other special tournaments. Real Madrid has won it the most, with 15 titles.
title: UEFA Champions League
